description: Place a directory on a stack so it can be accessed later. See also popd to switch back to original directory and dirs to display directory stack contents. More information: https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Directory-Stack-Builtins.html.

useCases.description: Switch to directory and push it on the stack:
Switch first and second directories on the stack:
Rotate stack by making the 5th element the top of the stack:
Rotate the stack 4 times to the left (the current directory stays at the top by replacing the 5th element):
